See also: liter

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • l, L (abbreviation)

Etymology[edit]

From French litre, from Ancient Greek λίτρα (lítra).

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈlɪtɐ/, /ˈliːtɐ/
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Liter m or n (genitive Liters, plural Liter)

  1. liter; litre

Usage notes[edit]

  • The German Institute for Standardization (DIN) recommends using the neuter gender (das Liter), but the word is now almost exclusively masculine. The neuter will sound ungrammatical to many or most native speakers.

Declension[edit]

Declension of Liter
singularplural
indef.def.noundef.noun
nominativeeinderLiterdieLiter
genitiveeinesdesLitersderLiter
dativeeinemdemLiterdenLitern
